alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 23 at 1:30PM EST until January 24 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: .Several waves of rainfall, Wednesday and again Thursday night, will produce a half to one inch of liquid. While a deeper snowpack will absorb some of this rain, there will be snowmelt yielding additional runoff into area creeks and streams, elevating their flow level. Recent reports have indicated ice formation on the Buffalo area creeks, as well as creeks and rivers in the western Southern Tier. As creeks and rivers rise, a mild airmass well into the 40s, and possibly lower 50s will encourage the creek and river ice to break, eventually leading to possible ice jams and subsequent flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam is possible. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following counties, Chautauqua, Northern Erie and Southern Erie. Creeks especially prone to ice jams include: Cayuga Creek, Buffalo Creek, Cazenovia Creek, Buffalo River as well as the Cattaraugus Creek near Sunset Bay. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks, especially if an ice jam occurs. Ice jams may result in water infiltrating the low lying lands along the creek and rivers paths. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The combination of snowmelt and rainfall runoff, with the encouragement of ice breakage within creeks and rivers may yield ice jam flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
